description.narrative: The Tobene project consists in the development, construction, operation and maintenance of a diesel HFO fired power plant convertible to gas operation, in Senegal. It is a greenfield plant with an installed capacity of 87.5 MW and a guaranteed capacity of 70 MW. It will be developed as an Independent Power Producer (IPP) incorporated under Tobene Power SA, selling power under a 20-year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) to Senelec (sole offtaker for the Project). The project was awarded to Melec PowerGen on a negotiated basis by the GoS, following initial International competitive bidding in 2008.

The project is expected to: - Provide base capacity addition to the main grid: the project will provide base load generation capacity of 70MW to Senegal''s interconnected system and due to its convenient location; it is also expected to add flexibility in handling electricity demand as well as to improve the system''s overall stability and reliability. The implementation of the project is critical for Senegal in order for the country to meet its fast growing electricity demand and, therefore, to solve the recurring problem of power shortages. this project will help displace some of the more expensive emergency power rental. - Promote private sector participation: The Project would be the third IPP in Senegal to be developed by the private sector. This is particularly important in the current context, in which the significant level of investments required is rapidly lagging behind. - Provide more efficient source of energy: At commissioning, the project is expected to be one of the most efficient thermal plants operating in Senegal, due to its steam turbine. Also, these MAN engine could be easily convertible to gas, which provide some flexibility to the system.

mailing-address.narrative: Samer Nasr Managing Director Melec PowerGen Inc. Corporate Headquarters: Matelec group Amchit main road, Ghorfine P.O. Box: 12 Jbeil, Lebanon +961-9 620920 Ext1200 +961 9 620934 Email: mailto:snasr@melecpowergen.com

Tobene Power disclosed the local ESIA in accordance with the Senegalese requirements and the document was made available to the DEEC (Department de lEnvironnement et des Etablissements Classés). Documentation including background information updates was also made available during the ESIA. The EIA and ESIA are made available with this document and for further information on the project Tobene Power should be contacted as per the details above.

name.narrative: The plant will be built on a site located in the local community of Taiba Ndiaye (about 90 kilometers North East of Dakar, in Senegal), in the department of Tivaouane, region of Thies. The Tobene plot is part of a larger plot of land owned by Senelec, who will be sold to the project company upon finalization of the Project development phase.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.
